In addition to detecting the SARS-CoV-2: Detecting both cell-expressed spike protein and live SARS-CoV-2 virus.
Neutralizing the SARS-CoV-2 virus in vitro.
Binding to multiple variants of the SARS-CoV-2 spike protein.
Inhibiting the replication of SARS-CoV-2 in host cells.
What advantage do minibinders have over: They are smaller and can be rapidly developed without extensive affinity maturation.
They have a longer half-life in the bloodstream.
They can be administered orally instead of intravenously.
They are more effective at neutralizing all variants of SARS-CoV-2.
What is the primary function of AlphaFol: It predicts protein structures and interactions to aid in designing minibinders with high affinity and specificity.
It synthesizes minibinders directly from amino acid sequences.
It performs in vitro testing of minibinder efficacy against SARS-CoV-2.
It sequences the genetic material of SARS-CoV-2 to identify potential binding sites.
What potential future application is sug: Designing binders for a wide range of targets to enhance synthetic biology applications.
Developing vaccines that provide lifelong immunity to SARS-CoV-2.
Creating antiviral drugs that can be taken as a daily supplement.
Engineering cells that can autonomously detect and destroy viruses.
